definitions.definition: To cut into something by clamping the teeth.
definitions.example: As soon as you bite that sandwich, you'll know how good it is.

definitions.definition: To hold something by clamping one's teeth.

definitions.example: That dog is about to bite!

definitions.definition: To behave aggressively; to reject advances.
definitions.example: If you see me, come and say hello. I don't bite.

definitions.definition: To take hold; to establish firm contact with.
definitions.example: I needed snow chains to make the tires bite.

definitions.definition: To have significant effect, often negative.
definitions.example: For homeowners with adjustable rate mortgages, rising interest will really bite.

definitions.definition: (of a fish) To bite a baited hook or other lure and thus be caught.
To accept something offered, often secretly or deceptively, to cause some action by the acceptor.
definitions.example: I've planted the story. Do you think they'll bite?
These mosquitoes are really biting today!

definitions.definition: To cause a smarting sensation; to have a property which causes such a sensation; to be pungent.
definitions.example: It bites like pepper or mustard.

definitions.definition: (sometimes figurative) To cause sharp pain or damage to; to hurt or injure.
To cause sharp pain; to produce anguish; to hurt or injure; to have the property of so doing.
To take or keep a firm hold.
To take hold of; to hold fast; to adhere to.
To lack quality; to be worthy of derision; to suck.
To perform oral sex on. Used in invective.
definitions.example: You don't like that I sat on your car? Bite me.
He always be biting my moves.

definitions.definition: To deceive or defraud; to take in.
